mdRecord.dcterms:description: Designed to accompany Waldseemüller's globe and wall map of the world, on which the New World is called America; "America" is suggested as the name for the New World on C3 verso. [original]
Folding plate of a terrestrial globe, with 14 lines of explanatory text beginning: propositu[m] situ[m] est hoc libello quanda[m] Cosmographiae introductione[m] scribere." [original]
Suggestion to name the new continent in honor of Amerigo Vespucci on p. [22]. [original]
With verses by Philesius Volesigenav [i.e. Matthias Ringmann] on verso of title page; dedication by Martinus Ilacomilus [i.e. Waldseemüller] on p. [3]. [original]
Signatures: A-B⁴ C⁶ D⁴ E⁶ F⁸ (F8 verso blank). [original]
Printed in black letter; decorative initials, and printed marginalia. [original]

SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Bound in full leather (possibly morocco); gilt lettered and decorated spine. Gilt tooled triple-rule borders on covers. Ornate gilt inside borders. Marbled endpapers. Tracy W. McGregor Library, American History Collection. This copy recataloged through a generous grant from the McGregor Fund. [original]
